p.q: John's students are talking about "Likes and dislikes." At the beginning of an activity, he gives them the following instruction: "Ask each other the question 'What's your favorite hobby?' as well as other wh-questions to get additional information." Before the students begin the task, he wants to check the students' comprehension of his instruction.
p.q2: Which of the following strategies is more appropriate for his purpose?

as.a: The teacher repeats the instruction as many times as necessary until the students know what to do.
The teacher chooses some students to come to the front of the class and help him model the activity.
The teacher calls one volunteer to explain to his classmates, in Spanish, what the instruction for the task is.
